NLS_STRINGS.GENCODE_ERR_NO_CODE_MODEL: Unable to get code model from the document
NLS_STRINGS.CODEGEN_CONN_VAR_DECL: %1 is the object to handle the connection for "%2"
NLS_STRINGS.CODEGEN_SEL_CMND: Informix Select command object is used in conjunction with %1 object for query of "%2"
NLS_STRINGS.CODEGEN_DEL_CMND: Informix Delete command object used in conjunction with %1 object for "%2"
NLS_STRINGS.CODEGEN_INSERT_CMND: Informix Insert command object used in conjunction with %1 object for inserting values into "%2" Database
NLS_STRINGS.CODEGEN_UPDATE_CMND: Informix Update command object used in conjunction with %1 object for update of database "%2"
NLS_STRINGS.GENCODE_SETTING_UP_INSERT: Set up the INSERT statement object for "%1" (database = "%2")
NLS_STRINGS.GENCODE_SETTING_UP_UPDATE: Set up the UPDATE statement object for "%1" (database = "%2")
NLS_STRINGS.GENCODE_SETTING_UP_DELETE: Set up the DELETE statement object for "%1" (database = "%2")
NLS_STRINGS.GENCODE_ADD_TO_INSERT_PARAM: Create an entry for each column of "%1" in the Insert command %2
NLS_STRINGS.GENCODE_ADD_TO_UPDATE_PARAM: Create an entry for each column of "%1" that appears in the UPDATE SET clause
NLS_STRINGS.GENCODE_ADD_TO_UPDATE_PARAM2: Now do the same for all columns appearing in the WHERE clause of "%1"s UPDATE statement
NLS_STRINGS.GENCODE_ADD_TO_DELETE_PARAM: Create an entry for each column of "%1" that appears in the WHERE of clause of its DELETE statement
NLS_STRINGS.CODEGEN_COL_HAS_NO_KEYSEQ: Column %1 is a primary key but its XML "COLUMN KEYSEQ" node has no value for it!
NLS_STRINGS.CODEGEN_DUP_COL_KEYSEQ_VALUE: Duplicate KEYSEQ number encountered. %1 is the duplicate KEYSEQ column.
NLS_STRINGS.CODEGEN_NO_TABLE_NAME: No Table or View Name found during building of the SELECT statement. Using the following default: %1
NLS_STRINGS.CODEGEN_SETUP_VARIABLES: Declare the command objects for "%1" ===> database "%2"
NLS_STRINGS.CODEGEN_ALL_IDENTITY_COLUMNS: No Update statement could be generated since all selected columns of "%1" are IDENTITY columns!
NLS_STRINGS.CODEGEN_NO_COLUMNS_U: No UPDATE or DELETE statement could be generated since table %1 has no columns!
NLS_STRINGS.CODEGEN_NO_COLUMNS_I: No INSERT or SELECT statement could be generated since table %1 has no columns!
NLS_STRINGS.CODEGEN_ALL_IDENTITY_I_COLUMNS: No Insert statement could be generated since all selected columns of "%1" are IDENTITY columns!
NLS_STRINGS.CODEGEN_SETUP_VARIABLES_SP: Declare the Informix Command variable for %1: "%2" (Database = "%3")
NLS_STRINGS.CODEGEN_INITIALIZERS_SP: Instantiate the SQL Informix command for %1: "%2" (database="%3")
NLS_STRINGS.CODEGEN_IBM_GEN_COMMENT_0: NOTE: The following call is required by the IBM Informix ADO engine.
NLS_STRINGS.CODEGEN_IBM_GEN_COMMENT_1: NOTE: The following procedure is required by the IBM Informix ADO engine.
NLS_STRINGS.CODEGEN_IBM_GEN_COMMENT_2: It can be modified using the Windows Form Designer.
NLS_STRINGS.CODEGEN_IBM_GEN_COMMENT_3: Do not modify it using the code editor.
NLS_STRINGS.NMP_DAWIZARD_WELCOME_INTRO: Welcome to the Informix Data Adapter Configuration Wizard
NLS_STRINGS.NMP_DAWIZARD_WELCOME_DESC: This wizard will help you specify the connection information and commands that the Informix data adapter uses to select, update, delete, and insert database records. Successful completion of this wizard depends on the permissions that you have in the database.
NLS_STRINGS.NMP_DAWIZARD_CONPAGE_DESC: The IBM Informix Data Adapter will use this connection to execute the query to load and update data.
NLS_STRINGS.NMP_DAWIZARD_CONPAGE_DETAIL_DESC: Create a new connection or reconfigure the connection shown in the listbox, if any.
NLS_STRINGS.NMP_DAWIZARD_SQLOPTPAGE_DESC: Choose Command Options and Command type; The IBM Informix Data Adapter will use the SQL INSERT, UPDATE, and DELETE statements to update the data source.
NLS_STRINGS.NMP_DAWIZARD_SQLOPTPAGE_DESC_DETAIL: If your Informix data adapter is used to update the data source, the wizard can generate the INSERT, UPDATE, and DELETE statements. The wizard will also step you through the generated statements for further modification and optimization. The Informix Data Adapter will use the SQL INSERT, UPDATE, and DELETE statements to update the data source.
NLS_STRINGS.NMP_DAWIZARD_SELECTPAGE_DESC: The IBM Informix Data Adapter will use SELECT statement to load the data into the data set.
NLS_STRINGS.NMP_DAWIZARD_SUMMARYPAGE_DESC: The Wizard is about to commit the configuration information, click "Finish" to save or "Back" to make changes.
NLS_STRINGS.NMP_DAWIZARD_SUMMARYPAGE_LBL: The wizard will perform the following tasks to configure the data adapter.
NLS_STRINGS.NMP_DAWIZARD_INSERTPAGE_DESC: The INSERT statement is used to add new data to the data source. You can either generate the statement, or type the statement.
NLS_STRINGS.IFX_DAWIZARD_INSERTPAGE_NOGENERATE_DESC: The INSERT statement is used to add new data to the data source.
NLS_STRINGS.NMP_DAWIZARD_DELETEPAGE_DESC: The DELETE statement is used to delete data from the data source. You can either generate the statement, or type the statement.
NLS_STRINGS.IFX_DAWIZARD_DELETEPAGE_NOGENERATE_DESC: The DELETE statement is used to delete data from the data source.
NLS_STRINGS.NMP_DAWIZARD_UPDATEPAGE_DESC: The UPDATE statement is used to update the data source. You can either generate the statement, or type the statement.
NLS_STRINGS.IFX_DAWIZARD_UPDATEPAGE_NOGENERATE_DESC: The UPDATE statement is used to update the data in the data source.
NLS_STRINGS.NMP_DAWIZARD_SUMMARYPAGE_FIN_MSG_LBL: To change a selection, click Back to return to previous pages of the wizard.
NLS_STRINGS.DB2VSREG_USAGE: Command usage: ifxvsreg [-register | -unregister] Command Options: -register : registers the specified targets. This is the default if neither -register nor -unregister is specified. -unregister : unregisters the specified targets.
NLS_STRINGS.DB2VSREG_SETTINGS_FILE_NOT_FOUND: The settings file for the ifxvsreg command could not be found, or was not well-formed.
NLS_STRINGS.DB2VSREG_SETTINGS_FILE_READ_ERROR: An error occurred while reading or attempting to read the settings file.
NLS_STRINGS.DB2VSREG_LOG_FILE_NOT_CREATED: The log file could not be created.
NLS_STRINGS.DB2VSREG_SETTINGS_FILE_NO_TARGET: There are no targets defined in the settings file.
NLS_STRINGS.DB2VSREG_SETTINGS_TARGET_NOT_FOUND: The specified target was not found. Valid targets are:
NLS_STRINGS.DB2VSREG_SETTINGS_FILE_UNKNOWN_COMMAND: The settings file contains an unrecognized command:
NLS_STRINGS.DB2VSREG_SETTINGS_FILE_UNKNOWN_FILE_TYPE: The settings file contains a missing or unrecognized file registration type.
NLS_STRINGS.DB2VSREG_SETTINGS_FILE_NODE_NO_FILE_NAME: The settings file contains a File node with no file name.
NLS_STRINGS.DB2VSREG_FILE_REGISTRATION_ERROR: An error occurred during registration of a file.
NLS_STRINGS.DB2VSREG_SELFREG_ENTRYPOINT_NOT_FOUND: The file is not a self-registering file.
NLS_STRINGS.DB2VSREG_SETTINGS_FILE_INVALID_SCRIPT_NO: The settings file contains an invalid Script node. Either the type is missing or unrecognized, or there is no script.
NLS_STRINGS.DB2VSREG_SCRIPT_INVALID_SUBSTITUTION: A script contains an improperly-defined substitution.
NLS_STRINGS.DB2VSREG_SETTINGS_INVALID_VARIABLE_NODE: The settings file contains a Variable node with missing or unrecognized attributes.
NLS_STRINGS.DB2VSREG_VARIABLE_NODE_FAILED: An error occurred while setting a variable.
NLS_STRINGS.DB2VSREG_SETTINGS_INVALID_COMMAND_NODE: The settings file contains a Command node with missing or unrecognized attributes.
NLS_STRINGS.DB2VSREG_COMMAND_EXECUTION_FAILED: An external command failed to execute.
NLS_STRINGS.DB2VSREG_COMMAND_EXECUTION_TIMEOUT: An external command did not complete within the expected amount of time.
NLS_STRINGS.DB2VSREG_COMMAND_FAILED: An external command exited with a failure code.
NLS_STRINGS.DB2VSREG_SETTINGS_INVALID_HELP_NODE: The settings file contains a Help node with missing or unrecognized attributes.
NLS_STRINGS.DB2VSREG_HELP_NO_LANG: No language was specified. Use the -lang command line parameter to specify a language.
NLS_STRINGS.DB2VSREG_SETTINGS_INVALID_AUTODECT_NODE: The settings file contains an Autodetect node with missing or unrecognized attributes.
NLS_STRINGS.DB2VSREG_AUTODETECTION_FAILED: An error occurred while trying to determine what features to install.
NLS_STRINGS.DB2VSREG_SELFREG_FAILED: The file did not register itself.
NLS_STRINGS.DB2VSREG_INSTALLING_VERSION_7.1: Installing support for Microsoft Visual Studio .NET 2003.
NLS_STRINGS.DB2VSREG_INSTALLATION_WARNING: WARNING: At least one warning indicating a potential problem with the installation has been reported. The installation may not be complete or correct.
NLS_STRINGS.DB2VSREG_INSTALLATION_MISSING_SETTINGS: The settings file has not been specified. Use the -settings command line argument to indicate the location of the AddinsReg.xml file.
NLS_STRINGS.DB2VREG_SETTINGS_INVALID_CONDITION_NODE: The settings file contains a Condition node with missing or unrecognized attributes.
NLS_STRINGS.DB2VSREG_CONDITION_FAILED: An error occured while evaluating a condition.
NLS_STRINGS.DB2VSREG_USER_FILE_DELETION_UNKNOWN_ROOT: The location of the user settings and cache files could not be determined.
NLS_STRINGS.DB2VSREG_USER_FILE_DELETION_FAILED: An error occurred while attempting to delete user settings and cache files.
NLS_STRINGS.NMP_DAWIZARD_NO_GEN_SQLSTMNT: SQL statements can not be generated when working offline with no live connections
NLS_STRINGS.DB2_CONSTRING_EDITOR_INVALID_CONSTRING: %1 is an invalid connection string. Please try again...
NLS_STRINGS.TextConnection: Specify connection type and database alias that you want to use for your connection.
NLS_STRINGS.UseCurrentUIDPwd: Use your current User name and password.
NLS_STRINGS.ConnReqd: A connection to %1 is required to complete this action.
NLS_STRINGS.MaxRows: Max Rows To Retrieve from Tables
NLS_STRINGS.DupConnError: Duplicate connection error! Please use a different database alias or user name and try again.
NLS_STRINGS.NoConnNameError: Connection name cannot be null. Please enter a connection name and try again.
NLS_STRINGS.OperationNotSupported: This operation is not supported on %1 platform.
NLS_STRINGS.ImportDuplicateDataAdapter: The Data Adapter %1 was not imported since it already exists in this connection.
NLS_STRINGS.EmptySelectStatement: Unable to preview data for data adapter %1 since select statement is empty.
NLS_STRINGS.Error_DataAdapterCreate: Error occurred when creating data adapter
NLS_STRINGS.Error_DataAdapterImport: Error occurred when importing data adapter
NLS_STRINGS.Error_DataAdapterExport: Error occurred when exporting data adapter
NLS_STRINGS.GENDATASET_ADAPTERERROR: The select statement of the DataAdapter may be incorrect or empty.
NLS_STRINGS.GENDATASET_PROJECTERROR: No project has been selected to add the DataSet to.
NLS_STRINGS.ErrorOnDatabaseDiscovery: Error occurred during discovery of databases
NLS_STRINGS.CONN_DETAIL_DSC: Select a data connection from the drop-down list. This list includes the data connections that are currently in the IBM Explorer. If you want to add a new connection, click New Connection.
NLS_STRINGS.GEN_DSET_DLG_DESC: Choose a &dataset that includes the specified table
NLS_STRINGS.GEN_DSET_DLG_TABLE_LIST: Choose one ore more &table(s) to add to the dataset
